channel.title: Function help
channel.description: Ok, im making this function and I get to a certain point. [scar]if (n = ??) Then[/scar] I want it to be like this. [b]If[/b] n equals 0 through 11 [b]of array[/b] Hoops [b]then[/b] What is the procedure, or something I can use, to go through every single array to see if [b]n[/b] matches with one of the arrays.

item.title: Function help
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Yup, look at what cruel posted.

I’ll break it down, too:

NewItemString := copy(ItemString, p+Length(t[i])+1, (Length(ItemString)-Length(t[i])+1));

Now, first, I call copy(), and the first parameter

copy(ItemString,

Is the String I’m copying from. Next, the parameter calls for the starting point within the String to begin copying, so I tell it this:

p+Length(t[i])+1

P holds the position of the first letter of one of the words (Wear, Wield, or Use). Then, it adds the length of the word it found

+Length(t[i])

So that it doesn’t copy the word which you are trying to trim out, and then it adds 1 to skip the space after the word.

The next parameter calls for a count of how many characters to copy starting from the position we just gave it.

This is what we have:

(Length(ItemString)-Length(t[i])+1)

First we get the length of the original item string (ItemString):

(Length(ItemString)

and subtract from it the length of found word(Wear, Wield, or Use). It does this because we are starting the copying after that word, and then we add one to that count for the space.

I hope that cleared it up,

-Weibs.

Read full topic

item.title: Function help
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

Read SCAR help file:

function copy(s: string; ifrom, icount: Longint): string; - returns part of the string (Copy('abcde',2,3) would return 'bcd'.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @junior junior
item.description:
@junior wrote:

you did it again bro. I understand everything until this point.
[scar]NewItemString := copy(ItemString, p+Length(t[i])+1, (Length(ItemString)-Length(t[i])+1));[/scar]
Can you explain what this means?

Read full topic

item.title: Function help
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Try this:

[code]program New;

procedure OnlyItemText(ItemString: String; var NewItemString: String);
var
p, i: Integer;
t: Array of String;

begin
t := [‘Wear’, ‘Use’, ‘Weild’];

for i := 0 to 2 do
begin
p := pos(t[i], ItemString);
if p > 0 then
begin
NewItemString := copy(ItemString, p+Length(t[i])+1, (Length(ItemString)-Length(t[i])+1));
Exit;
end;
end;
end;

var
Trimmed: String;

begin
ClearDebug;
OnlyItemText(‘Weild White apron’, Trimmed);
WriteLn(Trimmed);
end.[/code]

If you have any questions about what I did, just ask.

Read full topic

item.title: Function help
item.dc:creator: @junior junior
item.description:
@junior wrote:

Weibs:

Well, Ord() returns and Integer value, so you’d have to add an IntToStr() around the ‘h’.

DAM, thanks alot weibs.[br][size=1]Posted at: December 17, 2006, 09:42:26 PM[/size][hr]Why doesnt this work??

[scar]program New;

function OnlyItemText(ItemString : String) : String;
var
i,b,h,k : integer;
TrimT : array of string;

begin
TrimT:= [‘W’,‘e’,‘a’,‘r’,‘U’,‘s’,‘e’,‘W’,‘e’,‘i’,‘l’,‘d’]
b := 0

for i := 1 to 5 do
begin
b := b + 1
h := Ord(ItemString[b])

   for k := 0 to GetArrayLength(trimt)-1 do
    begin
    if (trimt[k] = inttostr(h)) then
      delete(itemstring, b, 1);
    end;

end;
Result := itemString;
Writeln(itemString);
end;

begin
cleardebug;
OnlyItemText(‘Wear White apron’)
end.[/scar]

Read full topic

item.title: Function help
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Well, Ord() returns an Integer value, so you’d have to add an IntToStr() around the ‘h’.

Read full topic

item.title: Function help
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

[code]function SearchArr(LookFor: String): Boolean;
var
i: Integer;

begin
for i := 0 to GetArrayLength(hoops)-1 do
begin
if (hoops[i] = LookFor) then
begin
Result := True;
Exit;
end;
end;
end;[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Function help
item.dc:creator: @bullzeye95 bullzeye
item.description:
@bullzeye95 wrote:

Try something like this:

[scar]function equalsArray(whatever: integer): boolean;
var temp, temp2: integer;
begin
setarraylength(hoops, getarraylength(hoops));
temp:= getarraylength(hoops);
for temp2:= 1 to temp do
begin
if(hoops[temp2] = whatever)then
result:= true;
end;
end;[/scar]

Read full topic
